message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper focuses on the design of a wireless communication system for critical industrial IoT applications, which involves the use of massive SIMO, noncoherent transmission, and non-orthogonal multiple access techniques. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.IT (Information Theory), which deals with the fundamental limits of reliable communication and the design of efficient coding and modulation schemes. The paper also discusses the application of the proposed framework to IIoT systems, which falls under the category of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Moreover, the paper considers the system's reliability and latency requirements, which are key aspects of cs.SY (Systems and Control). The use of massive SIMO also involves signal processing and optimization techniques, which are relevant to cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper presents simulation results to evaluate the performance of the proposed design, which can be considered as a machine learning problem and falls under the category of cs.LG (Machine Learning).
